messages.message:
Might be related to this (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753980826972419), but it seems like I'm unable to resolve source metadata for core-platform service on my sandbox (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/tonybackend3?cw=dev). It was working fine last night

```#5 [internal] load metadata for 549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/nodejs:22 (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/instabase-build/nodejs:22)

Doesn't look related to the above issue, as that was specific to push permissions and building connectors. All services are working for me.
Might be an issue with aws config/credentials and docker config.json

I'm guessing you already tried this: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753388110844289

Also looks like your sandbox might be out of date, and needs resync (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1753897690087479)
Looks like crafting isn't creating `~/.aws/credentials`  for me anymore. Do you have a copy that I can use? Will resync right after

```owner@dev:~$ cat  ~/.docker/config.json
{
  "credHelpers": {
     "gcr.io (http://gcr.io)": "gcloud",
     "549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com (http://549230430157.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com)": "ecr-login",
     "601729033846.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com (http://601729033846.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com)": "ecr-login"
  }
}owner@dev:~$ cat  ~/.aws/config
[profile default]
region = us-east-2
credential_process = idfed aws 519787998606 crafting-sandbox-roleowner@dev:~$ cat ~/.aws/credentials
cat: /home/owner/.aws/credentials: No such file or directory
owner@dev:~$ cat ~/.aws/credentials
cat: /home/owner/.aws/credentials: No such file or directory```
I don't have ~/.aws/credentials either. Your other files look correct.
So resync will probably resolve it.
I'm pretty sure I did that yesterday, but I'll try it again. No need to force update base right?
When I resynced mine, I did a force update.
